news_header: Sexually transmitted infections (STIs) are on the rise in Europe, with record cases of gonorrhea and syphilis reported in 2023. Gonorrhea cases reached nearly 100,000, particularly affecting young adults and men who have sex with men (MSM).
news_original_title: STIs in Europe: Gonorrhea and syphilis hit record highs
news_text: Syphilis cases increased by 13%, with MSM also representing a significant portion. Chlamydia remains the most common STI, though its rates are declining. Experts attribute the rise in bacterial STIs to decreased condom use among young people and emphasize the need for open discussions about sexual health and safe practices.
